      24             : inline bool
      25             : nsWrapperCache::HasKnownLiveWrapper() const
      26             : {
      27             :   // If we have a wrapper and it's not gray in the GC-marking sense, that means
      28             :   // that we can't be cycle-collected.  That's because the wrapper is being kept
      29             :   // alive by the JS engine (and not just due to being traced from some
      30             :   // cycle-collectable thing), and the wrapper holds us alive, so we know we're
      31             :   // not collectable.
      32             :   JSObject* o = GetWrapperPreserveColor();
      33             :   return o && !JS::ObjectIsMarkedGray(o);
      34             : }
      35             : 
      36             : static void
      37             : SearchGray(JS::GCCellPtr aGCThing, const char* aName, void* aClosure)
      38             : {
      39             :   bool* hasGrayObjects = static_cast<bool*>(aClosure);
      40             :   if (!*hasGrayObjects && aGCThing && JS::GCThingIsMarkedGray(aGCThing)) {
      41             :     *hasGrayObjects = true;
      42             :   }
      43             : }
      44             : 
      45             : inline bool
      46             : nsWrapperCache::HasNothingToTrace(nsISupports* aThis)
      47             : {
      48             :   nsXPCOMCycleCollectionParticipant* participant = nullptr;
      49             :   CallQueryInterface(aThis, &participant);
      50             :   bool hasGrayObjects = false;
      51             :   participant->Trace(aThis, TraceCallbackFunc(SearchGray), &hasGrayObjects);
      52             :   return !hasGrayObjects;
      53             : }
      54             : 
      55             : inline bool
      56             : nsWrapperCache::HasKnownLiveWrapperAndDoesNotNeedTracing(nsISupports* aThis)
      57             : {
      58             :   return HasKnownLiveWrapper() && HasNothingToTrace(aThis);
      59             : }
      60             : 
      61             : inline void
      62             : nsWrapperCache::MarkWrapperLive()
      63             : {
      64             :   // Just call GetWrapper and ignore the return value.  It will do the
      65             :   // gray-unmarking for us.
      66             :   GetWrapper();
      67             : }
